thread.title: Cash Is Burning a Hole in Companies’ Pockets - MoneyBeat - WSJ

author: Ben Eisen
title: Cash Is Burning a Hole in Companies’ Pockets - MoneyBeat - WSJ
text:
Companies are holding on to a ton of cash that could end up in shareholders’ hands, one reason some investors are turning more optimistic about the stock market. S&P 500 companies, excluding financials, had $2.39 trillion in cash and investments in 2017, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co. researchers. That’s up from $2.2 trillion in […]
